title: Implement JWT + API Key Authentication
description: Implement dual authentication: JWT for user sessions (15min access, 7-day refresh tokens) and API Keys for programmatic access (vp_ prefix, hashed storage). Both auth methods work on same endpoints. Includes registration, login, token refresh, logout, and API key management endpoints.
notes:
## Implementation Plan

**Architecture (iDesign layers):**
- Engines: JwtEngine, PasswordEngine, ApiKeyEngine (stateless crypto/token ops)
- Managers: AuthManager (business logic, orchestration)
- Accessors: RefreshTokenAccessor, ApiKeyAccessor (data access)
- Clients.Api: Auth handlers, AuthController, CurrentUserService

**New Entities:**
- RefreshToken: token rotation, device tracking, expiry
- ApiKey: vp_ prefix, SHA256 hashed, expiry support

**User Entity Updates:**
- PasswordHash, PasswordChangedAt, FailedLoginAttempts, LockoutEndsAt, LastLoginAt

**API Endpoints:**
- POST /auth/register - public
- POST /auth/login - public  
- POST /auth/refresh - public
- POST /auth/logout - authenticated
- GET /auth/me - authenticated
- POST /auth/api-keys - authenticated
- GET /auth/api-keys - authenticated
- DELETE /auth/api-keys/{id} - authenticated

**Security Features:**
- PBKDF2 (100k iterations) for passwords
- SHA256 for API keys
- Refresh token rotation
- Account lockout (5 attempts = 15min)
- 15min JWT, 7-day refresh tokens

**NuGet packages needed:**
- Microsoft.IdentityModel.Tokens
- System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Jwt
- Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.JwtBearer
close_reason: JWT + API Key authentication implementation complete. All phases implemented: Domain layer entities/DTOs, Engines for JWT/Password/ApiKey operations, Accessors for RefreshToken/ApiKey storage, AuthManager for business logic, Clients.Api handlers and AuthController, configuration, and database migration. Tested successfully: registration, login, JWT auth, API key creation, API key auth.
